definitions.definition: done on purpose rather than by accident

examples.text: The speech was a **deliberate attempt** to embarrass the government.
I'm afraid that was a deliberate ploy on my part.
The emphasis on Europe was quite deliberate.
They have a deliberate policy to involve people of all ages in the project.
She spoke in a slow and deliberate way.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (as an adjective): from Latin deliberatus, ‘considered carefully’, past participle of deliberare, from de- ‘down’ + librare ‘weigh’ (from libra ‘scales’).
